<a id="EditorInspectorPlugin"></a>

# EditorInspectorPlugin

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Plugin for adding custom property editors on the inspector.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

**EditorInspectorPlugin** allows adding custom property editors to [EditorInspector](EditorInspector.md).

When an object is edited, the [_can_handle()](EditorInspectorPlugin.md#EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__can_handle) function is called and must return ``true`` if the object type is supported.

If supported, the function [_parse_begin()](EditorInspectorPlugin.md#EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__parse_begin) will be called, allowing to place custom controls at the beginning of the class.

Subsequently, the [_parse_category()](EditorInspectorPlugin.md#EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__parse_category) and [_parse_property()](EditorInspectorPlugin.md#EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__parse_property) are called for every category and property. They offer the ability to add custom controls to the inspector too.

Finally, [_parse_end()](EditorInspectorPlugin.md#EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__parse_end) will be called.

On each of these calls, the "add" functions can be called.

To use **EditorInspectorPlugin**, register it using the [EditorPlugin.add_inspector_plugin()](EditorPlugin.md#EditorPlugin_method_add_inspector_plugin) method first.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Inspector plugins](../tutorials/plugins/editor/inspector_plugins.md)

## Method Descriptions

<a id="EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__can_handle"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **_can_handle**\ (\ object\: [Object](Object.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__can_handle)

Returns ``true`` if this object can be handled by this plugin.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__parse_begin"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **_parse_begin**\ (\ object\: [Object](Object.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__parse_begin)

Called to allow adding controls at the beginning of the property list for `object`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__parse_category"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **_parse_category**\ (\ object\: [Object](Object.md), category\: [String](String.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__parse_category)

Called to allow adding controls at the beginning of a category in the property list for `object`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__parse_end"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **_parse_end**\ (\ object\: [Object](Object.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__parse_end)

Called to allow adding controls at the end of the property list for `object`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__parse_group"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **_parse_group**\ (\ object\: [Object](Object.md), group\: [String](String.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__parse_group)

Called to allow adding controls at the beginning of a group or a sub-group in the property list for `object`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__parse_property"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **_parse_property**\ (\ object\: [Object](Object.md), type\: [Variant.Type](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Variant.Type), name\: [String](String.md), hint_type\: [PropertyHint](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_PropertyHint), hint_string\: [String](String.md), usage_flags\: **BitField**\[[PropertyUsageFlags](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_PropertyUsageFlags)\], wide\: [bool](bool.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorInspectorPlugin_private_method__parse_property)

Called to allow adding property-specific editors to the property list for `object`. The added editor control must extend [EditorProperty](EditorProperty.md). Returning ``true`` removes the built-in editor for this property, otherwise allows to insert a custom editor before the built-in one.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorInspectorPlugin_method_add_custom_control"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_custom_control**\ (\ control\: [Control](Control.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#EditorInspectorPlugin_method_add_custom_control)

Adds a custom control, which is not necessarily a property editor.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorInspectorPlugin_method_add_property_editor"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_property_editor**\ (\ property\: [String](String.md), editor\: [Control](Control.md), add_to_end\: [bool](bool.md) = false, label\: [String](String.md) = ""\ ) [ðŸ”—](#EditorInspectorPlugin_method_add_property_editor)

Adds a property editor for an individual property. The `editor` control must extend [EditorProperty](EditorProperty.md).

There can be multiple property editors for a property. If `add_to_end` is ``true``, this newly added editor will be displayed after all the other editors of the property whose `add_to_end` is ``false``. For example, the editor uses this parameter to add an "Edit Region" button for [Sprite2D.region_rect](Sprite2D.md#Sprite2D_property_region_rect) below the regular [Rect2](Rect2.md) editor.

\ `label` can be used to choose a custom label for the property editor in the inspector. If left empty, the label is computed from the name of the property instead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorInspectorPlugin_method_add_property_editor_for_multiple_properties"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_property_editor_for_multiple_properties**\ (\ label\: [String](String.md), properties\: [PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md), editor\: [Control](Control.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#EditorInspectorPlugin_method_add_property_editor_for_multiple_properties)

Adds an editor that allows modifying multiple properties. The `editor` control must extend [EditorProperty](EditorProperty.md).
